content: I thought this might be fun to do and a good deviation from the usual politics and bickering around here. so. just two questions. answer as best you can. I'll post the link to the answers later(if anyone has any interest). Question: If you are standing on the Moon, and holding a pen, and you let it go, it will: Choices: float away float where it is move sideways fall to the ground none of the above Question: When the Apollo astronauts were on the Moon, they did not fall off because: Choices: the Earth's gravity extends to the Moon the Moon has gravity they wore heavy boots they had safety ropes they had spiked shoes

content: The car the astronauts drove on the moon was... A. A Meyers Manx dune buggy. B. A big block Camaro. C. A Hemi 'Cuda. D. An electric vehicle. During one of the Apollo missions I saw a shooting star. I swear it had "Titleist" written on it.

content: I voted that it would float where it was and that the moon has gravity (just a lot less gravity). Curious to see the answers! It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

content: quote: I voted that it would float where it was and that the moon has gravity (just a lot less gravity). FollowMeInfantry The Moon has one-sixth the gravity of Earth. Astronauts on foot found that hopping was better than walking on the Moon. If the gravity were low enough to allow a pen to "float" the astronauts would shoot hundreds of feet up when hopping. I almost said "up into the air" but the moon has none. Which is also why an electric vehicle was chosen for transportation. The "Cuda, Camaro, and dune buggy would have been non-starters. But you all knew that! Moon cruiser Earth cruiser
quote: I voted that it would float where it was and that the moon has gravity (just a lot less gravity). FollowMeInfantry
reply: The Moon has one-sixth the gravity of Earth. Astronauts on foot found that hopping was better than walking on the Moon. If the gravity were low enough to allow a pen to "float" the astronauts would shoot hundreds of feet up when hopping. I almost said "up into the air" but the moon has none. Which is also why an electric vehicle was chosen for transportation. The "Cuda, Camaro, and dune buggy would have been non-starters. But you all knew that! Moon cruiser Earth cruiser
title: just for fun.

content: The moon has gravity, with a force ~1/6 that of the Earth. Anything within its sphere of influence will be attracted towards its surface, which is why neither the astronauts, the landers, the buggies, or dropped pens floated away. Drop a pen on the moon, and it falls, albeit slower than on Earth.
reply: The moon has gravity, with a force ~1/6 that of the Earth. Anything within its sphere of influence will be attracted towards its surface, which is why neither the astronauts, the landers, the buggies, or dropped pens floated away. Drop a pen on the moon, and it falls, albeit slower than on Earth.

content: quote: Even in vacuum sound (vibration) travels via OTHER materials such as a space suit glove or helmet. right. but ONLY if that object is impacted. otherwise there's no way for the sound/vibration to reach that "other material".

reply: right. but ONLY if that object is impacted. otherwise there's no way for the sound/vibration to reach that "other material".
